answers.answer: Hi Dale,The pain is likely related to your recent activity if it is muscular(not shooting, burning,numbness or tingling nerve-type pain).  If the Actos was started around the time of the muscle pains, then you should contact your doctor to determine if this is a side effect. Either way, if the pain continues after a few days, or worsens, or is associated with any weakness, please contact a doctor to be seen as soon as possible.Take care.

question: Dear Doctors:I am having extreme pain in my upper legs.  I just finished painting several rooms in my home and thought that it may have had a hand in some of the other discomforts I have felt in my legs since then. I do have diabetes II. I was diagnosed about 8 months ago I have been prescribed Actos. One pill a day.  All this is new to me and please help me to understand what is going on with me. Dale
title: Neropathy
